Key Match Events: The Celtics had whittled an 11-point deficit to 105-103 on Tatumâ€™s three-point play with 7:38 to play before the Pacers scored the next 13 points over nearly two minutes to take control.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Rick Carlisle wanted to see his team respond by getting off to a physical start.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics lost their sixth game at home already this season. Last season, they went 37-4 at TD Garden during the regular season and 9-2 in the playoffs en route to the NBA championship.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana made 22 free throws to just 16 for Boston.
The Pacers outscored Boston 66-48 in the paint.
Others: Tyrese Haliburton scored 31 points and the Indiana Pacers rebounded from a 37-point loss to Boston two nights earlier by beating the Celtics 123-114 on Sunday night in the rematch.
